Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2009 09:39AM - edited Feb 18, 2009 09:40AM by chiquita Please do not wait a year for another mammogram and ultrasound, my Doctor (the first one) was just postponing the biopsy and my lump was just growing...in the end it was cancer and I had a mastec but if it was found 6 months ago I could have only a lumpectomy...don't wait is better to be safe ...good luck.

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2009 02:08PM chiquita wrote: Hi Kelty...I had a mastectomy in November and the scars are bad...other th am that the surgery was ok and I feel good...my chemo is going ok two weeks bad and one good..I have to go back on Tuesday chemo number 3...I do not deed radiation, my oncologist did all ct/pet scans and blood tests and I holp the cancer will never return!!!! Good luck and enjoy your baby!!!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2009 02:59AM - edited Apr 4, 2009 03:00AM by chiquita I had a double mastectomy on November 08 and this week was my last Taxotere...I had 3 FEC and 3 Taxotere, the last one was the worse lots of SEs and a week of bed rest...the only medicine that work for me not to throw up was Ememd, I had to take nuprogin also for low white blood cells, it work fine and I was able to give the shots my self, they are 7 shots in seven days...newlast was not offer to me but I am glad because some people who took the shot complain of the pain and the shot taken to long to work or not working, if you are taking Taxotere ask for ice gloves or put your hands in a cup with ice to avoid loosing your finger nails and the pain in your fingers...you can also prepare for pain in your foot and a lot of losing skin in the foot....I think you all should read some of other topic and suggestions from other Forum they are GREAT....Good luck and take lots of drinks and Ice water and rest!!!!!

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 10:46PM - edited Mar 1, 2009 10:47PM by chiquita Your mom is luck to have you...but she is going to need a lot of help until she is comfortable, my husband is my nurse and he is retired with a lot of time, my daughter lives next door to us and never come to help me or weeks goes by without her calling to see if I am ok...very sad, because I took a lot time baby sitting for her... I know she is going to take chemo and the first week of chemo is hard and she need you to be there...be prepared to be there and if you cannot stay find someboddy  in the are. Good luck.

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2008 04:06AM chiquita wrote: Hi, I had a bi-lateral mastectomy on nov. 11 and I feel the scar is very tight...I only will think in reconstruction after all my chemo finish...today was my first chemo and I will have a 4 FAC every 3 weeks and 4 Taxo and Arimedex after that...I feel very sick and the pills for trowing up is not working...I have also a pain under my scar on the left side is like a needle poking at the muscle... we don't have the onco test here in Canada only in clinical tests and for us to have the test  and pay for it cost $3.600.00 so I will go with the chemo...My husband is very supportive of me and is in every appointment and doing a lot at home...I have 2 kids and 1 grandkid I love to play with, good luck to all of you and I know tomorrow will be better. God Bless us all...
